qTitle: What do minzoom and maxzoom do in Mapbox-GL-JS exactly?
answers: In vector tile source Let take example mytiles { type vector tiles [ minzoom maxzoom } This means If TileJSON file available I think ignore itsminzoomandmaxzoom` properties Never attempt fetch tile outside range If tile needed say zoom fetch equivalent tile zoom overzoom instead If tile needed say zoom display tile Underzooming never occurs If minzoom maxzoom properties defined source equivalent properties used TileJSON available Otherwise tiles assumed available zoom level requested overzooming occurs If tiles actually available display In vector layer Let take example referring source { id mylayer source mytiles source layer mytiles layer type fill minzoom maxzoom } This means Never display layer zooms less even though tiles available Attempt display layer zooms overzooming tiles required Never display layer zooms + If minzoom maxzoom properties defined layer attempt display given zoom within source zoom range

questions: I start web application main purpose displaying mapbox map toggle layers display data based interactions map I wondering I using mapboxgl js AND leaflet js mapboxgl js OR leaflet js Everyone keeps saying leaflet amazing wondering mapboxgl gives functionality performance I keep reading conflicting things internet Would really appreciate help
qTitle: mapboxgl.js versus leaflet.js
answers: A words clarify difference mapboxgl uses browsers WebGL technology therefore requires modern enough browser uses client computing power The advantage natively handle vector tiles render way like rotation tilt perspective like GPS navigation device custom style etc Leaflet uses plain DOM manipulation designed theoretically support old browsers like IE8 It efficient old browsers also mobile friendly due lightweight computing footprint The advantage enables including basic map without much overhead Most basic usages covered Leaflet possibly plugins The drawback mainly supports raster tiles must rendered server side mapbox provides service

qTitle: How I can migrate from `MGLConstantStyleValue` to `NSExpression`
answers: Identity interpolation mode uses value feature attribute style value Therefore stops dictionary unnecessary In case outlined looked like used value imageId With NSExpression want try layer iconImageName NSExpression forKeyPath imageId If would like stops dictionary taken account want consider using MGL MATCH takes initial condition followed possible matches key corresponding value assign layer property match The final argument default style value used none specified values match layer iconImageName NSExpression format MGL MATCH imageID imageID1 nameForImageID1 defaultImageName You find guides helpful Predicates Expressions Migrating Expressions

creating polygon features areas want shaded var cards [MGLPolygonFeature] [] var coordinates [CLLocationCoordinate2D] […] let card MGLPolygonFeature coordinates amp coordinates count UInt coordinates count card attributes [ address 123] … cards append card Within method runs map finishes loading MGLMapViewDelegate mapView didFinishLoading add shape source containing features current style let cardSource MGLShapeSource identifier cards features cards options [ ] mapView style addSource cardSource With shape source place create style layer renders polygon features mauve fills let fillLayer MGLFillStyleLayer identifier card fills source cardSource fillLayer fillColor NSExpression forConstantValue colorLiteral red 9098039216 green 8235294118 blue 9647058824 alpha mapView style addLayer fillLayer Then create another style layer renders labels polygon feature’s centroid MGLSymbolStyleLayer automatically calculates centroids accounting irregularly shaped polygons Same source fillLayer let labelLayer MGLSymbolStyleLayer identifier card labels source cardSource Each feature’s address integer text string labelLayer text NSExpression format CAST address NSString Smoothly interpolate transparent z16 opaque z17 labelLayer textOpacity NSExpression format mgl interpolate withCurveType parameters stops dollar zoomLevel linear nil percentage [ ] mapView style addLayer labelLayer As customize style layers pay particular attention options MGLSymbolStyleLayer control whether nearby symbols automatically hidden due collision You find automatic collision detection makes unnecessary specify textOpacity property When create source one options pass MGLShapeSource initializer MGLShapeSourceOption clustered However order use option you’d create MGLPointFeatures MGLPolygonFeatures Fortunately MGLPolygonFeature coordinate property lets find centroid without manual calculations var cardCentroids [MGLPointFeature] [] var coordinates [CLLocationCoordinate2D] […] let card MGLPolygonFeature coordinates amp coordinates count UInt coordinates count let cardCentroid MGLPointFeature cardCentroid coordinate card coordinate cardCentroid attributes [ address 123] cardCentroids append cardCentroid … let cardCentroidSource MGLShapeSource identifier card centroids features cardCentroids options [ clustered true] mapView style addSource cardCentroidSource This clustered source questions: I able query duration optimized route MapBox see I query distance optimized Maybe attribute I add
qTitle: How to query distance-optimized route from MapBox Directions API?
answers: According docs depends used routing profile fastest shortest route calculated type way e g highway sidewalk This API supports four different routing profiles mapbox driving traffic automotive routing This profile factors current historic traffic conditions avoid slowdowns Traffic available supported geographies mapbox driving automotive routing This profile shows fastest routes preferring high speed roads like highways mapbox walking pedestrian hiking routing This profile shows shortest path using sidewalks trails mapbox cycling bicycle routing This profile shows routes short safer cyclists avoiding highways preferring streets bike lanes The Mapbox Directions API powered OSRM routing engine Some background information regarding profiles

qTitle: Android : A/libc: Fatal signal 11 (SIGSEGV), code 1, fault addr 0x8 in tid 18372
answers: Issue solved based paragraph It important include location layer onStart onStop lifecycle events respective activity methods This prevents memory leaks occurring reduces battery consumption The plugin support new LifecycleObserver APIs adding plugin lifecycle observer activity need handle lifecycles manually source link mapbox locationLayer mapboxDemo LocationLayerPluginActivity java GitHub use methods functions locationPlugin new LocationLayerPlugin mapView mapboxMap locationEngine locationPlugin setLocationLayerEnabled true locationPlugin setCameraMode CameraMode TRACKING locationPlugin setRenderMode RenderMode COMPASS Lifecycle lifecycle getLifecycle lifecycle addObserver locationPlugin onStart Override public void onStart { super onStart mapView onStart locationEngine null { locationEngine requestLocationUpdates locationEngine addLocationEngineListener } } also onStop Override public void onStop { super onStop mapView onStop locationEngine null { locationEngine removeLocationEngineListener locationEngine removeLocationUpdates } } Fatal Signal Error gone I must say Thank mapbox support Team supporting solving problem

qTitle: Avoid coordinates when generating a route using Mapbox Direction API
answers: After months dealing MapBox Direction API come conclusion reliable specific use case When calculating routes Point A Point B using Direction API MapBox offers option includesAlternativeRoutes set true provides alternative routes However consistent cases returns preferred route According MapBox If value property true server attempts find additional reasonable routes visit waypoints Regardless multiple routes returned possible visit waypoints different route without significantly increasing distance travel time So switch Google Maps feature crucial business logic

qTitle: Type '(err: any, data: any) => void' has no properties in common with type 'RequestInit'
answers: The type information d3 suggests promise based interface perhaps older versions used callbacks Your code follows callback pattern d3 json function err data { Handle err Use data } Here promise version d3 json data gt { Use data } catch err gt { Handle err } Typed Response The data get back typed Pass type argument json method tell kind data get back For example interface ResponseData { features any[] } d3 json lt ResponseData gt data gt { Use data } catch err gt { Handle err }

qTitle: What are the consequences of using other geojson projections while creating vector tiles using tippecannoe?
answers: According vector tile spec Vector Tiles MAY used represent data projection tile extent scheme So really wanted could store data another projection long whatever reading knew going You able use Mapbox GL JS I think supports EPSG 4326 latitudes longitudes But sound like want Can someone explain direct towards basic differences various kinds projections In nutshell instead latitudes longitudes stored GeoJSON eg coordinates [145 ] projections define different coordinate systems usually based X Y positions flat map For instance point might [19384792 852341] Only latitudes longitudes allowed current GeoJSON spec though Most likely want reproject GeoJSON conversion suggested tippecanoe EPSG 26915

qTitle: How to handle props and states to avoid infinite loops?
answers: componentDidUpdate invoked immediately update call setState without wrapped condition inevitably cause infinite loop occur You could call setState based comparison new previous props componentDidUpdate prevProps { props data prevProps data fetchNewData props data }

qTitle: lateinit value is always null or not initialized with MapBox
answers: So override fun onCreateView inflater LayoutInflater container ViewGroup savedInstanceState Bundle View { return inflater inflate R layout fragment item four container false } You returning view attached Fragment actually displayed Here fun onCreate savedInstanceState Bundle context Context inflater LayoutInflater container ViewGroup { super onCreate savedInstanceState Mapbox Access token Mapbox getInstance context getString R string token mapbox val view inflater inflate R layout activity main container false mapView view findViewById R id mapview mapView onCreate savedInstanceState mapView getMapAsync { setStyle Style SATELLITE Customize map markers polylines etc } } You inflating new view never attached anything It also inflating separate layout activity main xml I assume include MapView Instead resolve MapView within onViewCreated returned inflated view onCreateView override fun onViewCreated View view Bundle savedState { mapView view findViewById R id mapview apply { onCreate savedState getMapAsync { map gt map setStyle Style SATELLITE } } } You also use lateinit var property guaranteed view created e g onCreateView never invoked One instance Fragment backstack user visible On configuration change recreation Activity Fragment backstack go onCreate create view In case would run crash onStart attempting reference mapView initialized Instead leave nullable perform operations mapView doThing

qTitle: MGLMapView scaleBar position at bottom by updating constraints
answers: First first constraint specifies NSLayoutRelationGreaterThanOrEqual relation means scaleBar bottom edge must somewhere bottom edge map view + constant specified This obviously true scale bar positioned top map view So try replace NSLayoutRelationGreaterThanOrEqual NSLayoutRelationEqual see trick Warning You adding constraints self mapboxMapView direct superview scaleBar In Mapbox library add constraints containerView This bad practice I recommend use [NSLayoutConstraint activateConstraints scaleBarConstraints] instead automatically add constraints adequate view Apple recommends documentation Warning Generally hack view hierarchy another class You cannot assume create new constraints point time might override conflict constraints

qTitle: How do you create a Custom Callout for Mapbox annotations?
answers: MGLAnnotation NSObjectProtocol That requires classes object implements CLLocationCoordinate2D This object data model relate closely For simplicity I inherited NSObject CustomAnnotation swift import Foundation import UIKit import Mapbox class CustomAnnotation NSObject MGLAnnotation { var coordinate CLLocationCoordinate2D var title String var subtitle String var image UIImage init coordinate CLLocationCoordinate2D title String subtitle String image UIImage { self coordinate coordinate self title title self subtitle subtitle self image image } } Your custom callout view MGLCalloutView yet another protocol class object inheriting NSObject conform following required properties note I subclassing UIView inherits NSObject class CustomCallOutView UIView MGLCalloutView { var representedObject MGLAnnotation Required views unused relax lazy var leftAccessoryView UIView lazy var rightAccessoryView UIView var delegate MGLCalloutViewDelegate required init annotation MGLAnnotation { self representedObject annotation super init } func presentCallout rect CGRect view UIView constrainedTo constrainedRect CGRect animated Bool { } func dismissCallout animated Bool { } } Note require init annotation bit misleading one would expect annotation object instead object conforms MGLAnnotation change data model version MGLAnnotation required init annotation CustomAnnotation { self representedObject annotation super init } Now MGLCalloutViewDelegate delegate method presentCallout rect view constrainedRect add custom callout self mapView passed delegate function view We also want remove view super view dismissed func presentCallout rect CGRect view UIView constrainedTo constrainedRect CGRect animated Bool { view addSubview self } func dismissCallout animated Bool { animated { something cool removeFromSuperview } else { removeFromSuperview } } Finally mapView calloutViewFor annotation method create new custom annotation class object conformed MGLAnnotation pass custom callout view func mapView mapView MGLMapView calloutViewFor annotation MGLAnnotation gt MGLCalloutView { let title annotation title nil let subtitle annotation subtitle nil let image UIImage named apple png let customAnnotation CustomAnnotation coordinate annotation coordinate title title title subtitle subtitle subtitle image image return CustomCalloutView annotation customAnnotation } For reference rest full implementation CustomAnnotation swift see ViewController swift import UIKit import Mapbox class ViewController UIViewController MGLMapViewDelegate { lazy var mapView MGLMapView { let mv MGLMapView frame self view bounds styleURL URL string mapbox styles mapbox streets v10 mv autoresizingMask [ flexibleWidth flexibleHeight] mv setCenter CLLocationCoordinate2D latitude 7326808 longitude 9843407 zoomLevel animated false return mv } override func viewDidLoad { super viewDidLoad Do additional setup loading view typically nib setup Declare marker `hello` set coordinates title subtitle let hello MGLPointAnnotation hello coordinate CLLocationCoordinate2D latitude 7326808 longitude 9843407 hello title Hello world hello subtitle Welcome marker Add marker `hello` map mapView addAnnotation hello } func setup { self view addSubview mapView mapView delegate self } override func didReceiveMemoryWarning { super didReceiveMemoryWarning Dispose resources recreated } Use default marker See also view annotation custom marker examples func mapView mapView MGLMapView viewFor annotation MGLAnnotation gt MGLAnnotationView { return nil } Allow callout view appear annotation tapped func mapView mapView MGLMapView annotationCanShowCallout annotation MGLAnnotation gt Bool { return true } func mapView mapView MGLMapView calloutViewFor annotation MGLAnnotation gt MGLCalloutView { let title annotation title nil let subtitle annotation subtitle nil let image UIImage named apple png let customAnnotation CustomAnnotation coordinate annotation coordinate title title title subtitle subtitle subtitle image image return CustomCalloutView annotation customAnnotation } } CustomCalloutView import Foundation import Mapbox class CustomCalloutView UIView MGLCalloutView { var representedObject MGLAnnotation Required views unused relax lazy var leftAccessoryView UIView lazy var rightAccessoryView UIView weak var delegate MGLCalloutViewDelegate MARK Subviews let titleLabel UILabel { let label UILabel label translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints false label font UIFont boldSystemFont ofSize return label } let subtitleLabel UILabel { let label UILabel label translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints false return label } let imageView UIImageView { let imageview UIImageView frame CGRect x width height imageview translatesAutoresizingMaskIntoConstraints false imageview contentMode scaleAspectFit return imageview } required init annotation CustomAnnotation { self representedObject annotation init percentage width 120px tall super init frame CGRect origin CGPoint x size CGSize width UIScreen main bounds width height 120 self titleLabel text self representedObject title self subtitleLabel text self representedObject subtitle self imageView image annotation image setup } required init coder decoder NSCoder { fatalError init coder implemented } func setup { setup view properties self backgroundColor UIColor white And Subviews self addSubview titleLabel self addSubview subtitleLabel self addSubview imageView Add Constraints subviews let spacing CGFloat imageView topAnchor constraint equalTo self topAnchor constant spacing isActive true questions: Has anyone used either Mapbox OpenMapTiles vector tiles find routes one place another It seems like tiles made display contain intersection information way say Open Street Map
qTitle: Vector tile route finding
answers: Mapbox directions API uses Open Street Map Mapbox’s directions services use network roads paths ways derived OpenStreetMap collaborative project create free editable map world Contributors OpenStreetMap built vast routeable network includes properties like speed limits turn lane restrictions accessibility bikes pedestrians These details provide framework Open Source Routing Machine OSRM needs calculate fastest path mode transportation driving cycling walking So answer yes tiles contain routing graph meant display Waypoints retrieved via API allow display route top Here example use mapbox gl OpenMapTiles time offer routing far I know

qTitle: Loading 1 API of another API's data
answers: Questions like often best answered reading reference This method asynchronous meaning finish next line sketch executed This means temp[i] loadJSON urlC line fires finish console log temp line executes This loadJSON function asynchronous means runs background main thread This generally useful want code freeze every time make new request also leads bugs like To get around add callback function loadJSON lines Again reference function setup { noLoop var url + summary day geojson loadJSON url drawEarthquake } function draw { background 200 } function drawEarthquake earthquakes { Get magnitude name earthquake loaded JSON var earthquakeMag earthquakes features[ ] properties mag var earthquakeName earthquakes features[ ] properties place ellipse width height earthquakeMag earthquakeMag textAlign CENTER text earthquakeName height width } Notice drawEarthquake function passed loadJSON function When loadJSON function completes call drawEarthequake function automatically You probably want something similar

qTitle: Mapbox Navigation Off Route Detection not working
answers: Troy Berg Let take quick second explain route following code works internally fresh route loaded Upon loading new route route json valid MapboxNavigator start INITIALIZED state From attempt gain confidence GPS locations passed actually location user To establish trust needs receive least location updates must consequtively coherent time space While process establishing trust report INITIALIZED state Once trust users current stream location updates established MapboxNavigator attempt measure user progress along currently loaded route If user location found unreasonably far route state flipped OFFROUTE state If user current location within reasonable distance currently loaded route close enough considered route TRACKING continue return INITIALIZED state wait user make way route We call corraling Corraling allows user driveway store parking lot example load route immediately get marked OFFROUTE While corraling user continually makes progress away route eventually marked OFFROUTE

qTitle: maximum call stack size exceeded on Mapbox
answers: In javascript function executed special place called call stack actually stack queue methods executing If example function A calls function B inside calls function C inside essentially create call stack order A B C When function completed execution essentially surrenders execution time callee words stack evaluated top bottom time function returns execution moves layer stack Now say maximum call stack exceeded means call stack large references held things break This usually happens case recursive functions gone wrong You recursive function error seems normal logical point stops executing recursions returns unfolding call stack backwards In essence error must somewhere theese lines counter lt 100 { console log counter counter counter + animateicon route point map } actual recursion call happening Make sure counter indeed increased scope counter variable correct Because use variable termination logic would pass variable line recursion like var counter function animateicon route point map counter { } later counter lt 100 { console log counter counter counter + animateicon route point map counter }

questions: I following array var SplitUpLevels [ [ zoomLevel locationIDs [ ]] [ zoomLevel locationIDs [ ]] ] I want hide icons map based individual zoomlevel location ID array I get values dynamically JSON source I already tried simple forEach loop without success icon opacity [ interpolate [ linear ] [ zoom ] SplitUpLevels forEach function SplitUpLevel { SplitUpLevel zoomlevel [ match [ get Id ] SplitUpLevel locationIDs ] } … ] I either get response icon opacity Expected even number arguments icon opacity[ ] Input output pairs interpolate expressions must defined using literal numeric values computed expressions input values What best way build expression based dynamic source
qTitle: Mapbox GL JS: build match expression based on multidimensional array
answers: In case someone else searching solution create expression array use add layer var iconopacity [ interpolate linear zoom ] Then push expression array json file SplitUpLevels forEach function SplitUpLevel { iconopacity push SplitUpLevel zoomlevel [ match [ get Id ] SplitUpLevel locationIDs ] } Then add new layer map addLayer { […] paint { icon opacity iconopacity } } After long search I still decided adapt data advance using PHP script instead creating complicated filter rules

qTitle: How to pass custom fields into mapbox-gl js to create points on map?
answers: Figured First I created plugin stored custom post data JSON array stored server This also updated every time I updated saved deleted post Here example JSON data { placeList [{ title Shake Shack slug shake shack latitude 609844 longitude 286894 } { title Starbucks slug starbucks latitude 619071 longitude 286649 }]} Then php file I called json file javascript inserted array GeoJSON var placeJson data var geojson { type FeatureCollection features [] } lt placeJson placeList length i++ { geojson features push { type Feature geometry { type Point coordinates [placeJson placeList[i] latitude placeJson placeList[i] longitude] } properties { id placeJson placeList[i] slug title placeJson placeList[i] title } } }

answers: Finally I managed way accomodate requirements It includes following steps At driver app using mapbox framework didRerouteAlongRoute delegate create array containing new route latitude longitude dictionaries like void navigationViewController MBNavigationViewController navigationViewController didRerouteAlongRoute MBRoute route{ CLLocationCoordinate2D routeCoordinates malloc route coordinateCount sizeof CLLocationCoordinate2D [route getCoordinates routeCoordinates] NSMutableArray routeArray [NSMutableArray new] NSValue value route coordinates { CLLocationCoordinate2D coordinate [value getValue amp coordinate] NSDictionary coDic { latitude [NSNumber numberWithDouble coordinate latitude] longitude [NSNumber numberWithDouble coordinate longitude]} [routeArray addObject coDic] } } Then send new route information server API serialising array reRouteJSONString following NSError error NSString reRouteJSONString NSData reRouteJSONData [NSJSONSerialization dataWithJSONObject routeArray options NSJSONWritingPrettyPrinted error amp error] reRouteJSONString [[NSString alloc] initWithData reRouteJSONData encoding NSUTF8StringEncoding] And rider app manipulate information following form new route polyline void makeReroutePolyline NSString serialisedString{ MKMapView mapView mapView delegate self NSError jsonError NSData objectData [serialisedString dataUsingEncoding NSUTF8StringEncoding] NSArray json [NSJSONSerialization JSONObjectWithData objectData options NSJSONReadingMutableContainers error amp jsonError] CLLocationCoordinate2D coordinates[json count] NSInteger index index lt json count index++ { CLLocationCoordinate2D coordinate { [[json objectAtIndex index][ latitude ] doubleValue] [[json objectAtIndex index][ longitude ] doubleValue] } coordinates[index] coordinate } MKPolyline routeLine routeLine [MKPolyline polylineWithCoordinates coordinates count json count] [mapView addOverlay routeLine] [mapView setVisibleMapRect [routeLine boundingMapRect] edgePadding UIEdgeInsetsZero animated YES] }

questions: In web application initially map set non interactive user move around map var map new mapboxgl Map { container map style mapbox styles mapbox dark v10 zoom interactive false } However user clicks button I want map become interactive user move around map I tried setting interactive property true work map interactive true Any suggestions
qTitle: MapBox GL JS: Make a non-interactive map interactive
answers: You correct cannot change interactive option instantiated map instance So seems couple options Instantiate new non interactive map replace interactive one Disable pointer events css rule map container element mentioned issue tracker Good luck
